intro: Galium tenuicaule, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, prostrate stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium tenuicaule is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
